content:
本件保存 年
51.5. 29 10556 V.O.
S G. 2
CUSA
DEPARTMENT OF STATE AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT UNITED STATES AID MISSION TO CHINA
MAY 28 1962
MC- 3860
TO
: Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief, Second Division, CUSA
FROM
: H. T. Potter, Supply Advisor, US AID/C
8
SUBJECT: Excess Equipment Project No. Y-99-AX (99-471)
REF
: Memorandum C2-62-1572 dated May 18, 1962
Forwarded herewith is a copy of a memo. dated May 24, 1962, which is self explanatory. You will note that the Technician has advised that before he will concur in the allocation he requires that CUSA state its approval. He also requests that disposition be clearly stated, presently it is not possible to determine the quantities to be allocated to KaHB and KIHB should the equipment be available for transfer. The feasibility of procuring equipment in need of "considerable repairs" should also be checked into. The costs of shipping the crane shovel in question will be very high.
The auto. release date for the wire rope was 4/30/62, and the pump and motor 5/17/62, therefore, it is too late to forward freeze requests for these items and they should be deleted.
Your early attention to this matter will be appreciated.
Encl. As stated
E
优 心调的
國史饭 Academia Historica
313

paragraphs.content: DEPARTMENT OF STATE AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT UNITED STATES AID MISSION TO CHINA
: Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief, Second Division, CUSA
: H. T. Potter, Supply Advisor, US AID/C
SUBJECT: Excess Equipment Project No. Y-99-AX (99-471)

Forwarded herewith is a copy of a memo. dated May 24, 1962, which is self explanatory. You will note that the Technician has advised that before he will concur in the allocation he requires that CUSA state its approval. He also requests that disposition be clearly stated, presently it is not possible to determine the quantities to be allocated to KaHB and KIHB should the equipment be available for transfer. The feasibility of procuring equipment in need of "considerable repairs" should also be checked into. The costs of shipping the crane shovel in question will be very high.
The auto. release date for the wire rope was 4/30/62, and the pump and motor 5/17/62, therefore, it is too late to forward freeze requests for these items and they should be deleted.
Your early attention to this matter will be appreciated.
